begin again (2014)

The latest film from writer-director John Carney ("Once"), Begin Again is a soul-stirring comedy about what happens when lost souls meet and make beautiful music together. A chance encounter between a disgraced music-business executive and a young singer-songwriter new to Manhattan turns into a promising collaboration between the two talents. Gretta (Keira Knightley) and her long-time boyfriend Dave (Adam Levine) are college sweethearts and songwriting partners who decamp for New York when he lands a deal with a major label. But the trappings of his new-found fame soon tempt Dave to stray, and a reeling, lovelorn Gretta is left on her own. Her world takes a turn for the better when Dan (Mark Ruffalo), a disgraced record-label exec, stumbles upon her performing on an East Village stage and is immediately captivated by her raw talent. From this chance encounter emerges an enchanting portrait of a mutually transformative collaboration, set to the soundtrack of a summer in New York City. The indie film is a radiant exploration of creativity and character, melding beautiful music with a rich setting to tell a musical story.

release

Begin Again is a musical comedy-drama film with a runtime of 1 hour and 13 minutes. The film first released in September 7, 2013 and later given a wide release in summer 2014.

starring

Kiera Knightley stars as Greta James alongside Mark Ruffalo as Dan Mulligan and a musical ensemble supporting cast. John Carney wrote and directed the film.

reception

Begin Again premiered to generally positive reviews from critics with a 83% rating on Rotten Tomatoes and a 62 rating on Metacritic. The film grossed over 63 million.
